The Brimstone chest can be found next to Konar quo Maten on Mount Karuulm. The chest is locked and can only be opened by using a brimstone key, which is obtained from killing monsters that Konar assigns the player.

The exact odds of receiving the key are 1/100 for level 100 monsters and 1/50 for level 350 monsters, scaling linearly and capping at 350 as shown in formula 2.[1] For lower level monsters, it follows a curve: as shown in formula 1.[2]

P ( L ) = 1 100 + ⌊ ( 100 − L ) 2 / 5 ⌋ L ∈ ( 0 , 100 ) ( 1 ) P ( L ) = 1 120 − ⌊ L / 5 ⌋ L ∈ [ 100 , 350 ] ( 2 ) {\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}P(L)&={\frac {1}{100+\lfloor (100-L)^{2}/5\rfloor }}&L\in (0,100)&&(1)\\P(L)&={\frac {1}{120-\lfloor L/5\rfloor }}&L\in [100,350]&&(2)\end{aligned}}}

Where P is the probability of a drop and L is the monster's combat level. {\displaystyle {\text{Where P is the probability of a drop and L is the monster's combat level.}}}

Possible loot[edit | edit source]

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.

The brimstone chest usually contains generic loot meant as a slight increase to the player's profits. There is also a rare chance of getting a broken dragon hasta, which can be repaired, for free, by simply showing it to Otto Godblessed (Barbarian Training in Smithing is not required for this). There's also a slim chance of obtaining pieces of the dusk mystic robe set, which come with a colour scheme similar to that of Mount Karuulm.

The average value of a drop from this table is 114,782.26.[3]

Changes[edit | edit source]

For changes in the drop table contents, see here.
Date Changes
14 March 2019
(update | poll)

The brimstone chest now tracks the amount of times the player has opened it.

21 February 2019
(update)

Loot obtained from the chest is now broadcasted in the chatbox to players within the vicinity.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Several items can be seen inside the brimstone chest while it is open, including piles of coins, stacks of bank notes, rubies, and vials of a yellow potion. This is a reference to the loot players can receive from the chest.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Kieren's Twitter account. 16 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 26 May 2020.) Mod Kieren: "It follows a curve up until level 100 then scales linearly between those 2 values upto level 350 combat. Creatures over thsi[sic] will cap at 1/50. [1]"
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Kieren's Twitter account. 16 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 29 April 2020.) Mod Kieren: "0.2*(CBLEVEL - 100)^2 + 100"
  3. ^ The Old School Team. "Revised Post Kebos Poll Blog". 21 January 2019. Developers' Blogs. *
